page.title: 10SCAMPTON POST OFFICE
page.content: The Postmistress of Scampton post office is Mrs Voase. She and her husband both come from Yorkshire. Before they came here they had a small holding of 12,000 Chickens, 300 pigs, 200 Ducks, 6 Geese and 5 acres of soft fruit. They have two sons called Jamie and Garry. The post office is stone built and it is attached to their house. Four helpers begin sorting the mail out at 7am in the morning. The post office opens at 8.30am to 5.30pm every day except on Thursdays and Saturday which are half days. The post office's sections are stamps, postal orders, pensions, child allowance, premium bonds and saving certificates. In the general section are a great selection of frozen food, knitting wool, stationery, grocery, green grocery, sweets and many more items.
